required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2 Study of Dacomitinib in NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-arm, Open-label, Phase 2 Study of Dacomitinib With or Without Dose Titration for the First-line Treatment of Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-small Cell Lung Cancer in Subjects With an Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Activation Mutation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-national, multi-centre, single-arm, open-label, Phase 2 clinical study of the efficacy and safety of first-line treatment with dacomitinib, with or without dose titration, in subjects with newly diagnosed stage IIIB/IV or recurrent EGFR-mutation-positive Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of treatment to the date of disease progression or death due to any cause, up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of treatment to the date of death for any cause, up to 2 years
From the start of treatment until disease progression, up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with a best overall response of either complete response (CR) or partial response (PR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of treatment to the last dose of treatment, up to 2 years
From the start of treatment until disease progression, up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with a best overall response of either CR or PR of intracranial disease

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of treatment to the date of intracranial progression or death due to any cause, up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of incidences of adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to 28 days after end of treatment

clinical_study.condition: EGFR Positive Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

intervention.description: 30mg of oral dacomitinib is administered daily for one cycle. After one cycle, a toxicity assessment will be conducted. Subjects will then continue dacomitinib at either 30mg or 45mg.
